content: @nikomatsakis On dropbox paper alternatives: It might be worth trying hackmd, they just added support for rendering visualisations in documents in JSON using Vega, which can use Google Sheets as a data source. https://vega.github.io/vega-lite/
my main concern with hackmd has been their comment system is very ungood

to be more specific, it's not obvious to most people how to add comments, replying is sort of awkward, and there's no "Resolve" button to clear away comments en masse (only way I found to remove them is manually deleting them)
in general, the collaboration workflow feels pretty limited
scrolling when in "mixed mode" doesn't work well for me, it moves in jumps and starts, and sometimes sort of refuses to scroll down and I have to keep trying, and then it scrolls me back up again
I definitely agree with that. I think colloboration workflow is Dropbox Papers strong point.
yeah. collaboration is good, but scaling is poor, and markdown export doesn't work very well (partly markdown's fault; it can't express some things afaict that dropbox paper would need)
anyway... this is OT for this topic I guess :)
I have made a spreadsheet and I'm putting in any data that's mentioned in the outline. https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1xBRdh7_5d3Gd-gycR1RbCfaSdtM-uasuTdMRlRFUCHs/edit?usp=sharing
